questions.question_text:
You must implement a backup solution for your Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW) that will enable you to restore data as old as one year with a recovery point objective (RPO) of 10 days.
Which database backup strategy would you select?

discussion.content: Answer is A. Standard ADW Backup retention period is 60 days. For meeting the 12 months retention backup with RPO of 10 days, we should have to do weekly manual backups and store them in Object Storage with a 1 year retention policy.

It would seem that the automatic backups are enough. We can't keep a manual backup longer then 60 days.
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud/user/backup-manual.html#GUID-3C1B814B-1552-45C7-8856-4AC623E0AD6D

Each manual backup creates a full backup on your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage bucket and the backup can only be used by the Autonomous Data Warehouse instance when you initiate a point-in-time-recovery.

The retention period for manual backups is the same as for automatic backups, which is 60 days.

choices.A: Take weekly manual backups to supplement the automated backups and preserve them for 12 months.
choices.C: Take monthly manual backups to supplement the automated backups and preserve them for 12 months.
choices.D: Take quarterly manual backups to supplement the automated backups and preserve them for 12 months.

questions.question_text: Which service is NOT supported by Oracle Cloud Infrastructure CLI?

You have five different company locations spread across the US. For a proof-of-concept (POC) you need to setup secure and encrypted connectivity to your workloads running in a single virtual cloud network (VCN) in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Ashburn region from all company locations.
What would meet this requirement?

discussion.content: answer C . the vcn only can have a single drg
Agreed, C is the answer
C is right
Answer is C. Only one DRG per VCN.
answer - d, IPSec VPN

choices.C: Create five IPsec connections with each company location and terminate those connections on a single DRG. Attach that DRG to your VCN.
choices.B: Create five virtual circuits using FastConnect for each company location and terminate those connections on a single dynamic routing gateway (DRG). Attach that DRG to your VCN.
choices.A: Create five internet gateways in your VCN and have separate route table for each internet gateway.
choices.D: Create five IPsec VPN connections with each company location and terminate those connections on five separate DRGs. Attach those DRGs to your VCN.

choices.E: monitor database activity and SQL queries

discussion.content: It's CDE, A is not done in Service Console.

Selected Answer: ABC
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/manage-users-create.html#GUID-132CEDFA-BCA8-45F4-92E8-3774A9A63DD2
A, B y E, You can see in your console, try it!
Answer is : CDE
C,D & E is the ans
CDE, Correct

questions.question_text:
You have provisioned an Autonomous Transaction Processing (ATP) database and logged into the ATP service console.
What are three abilities that can be performed from this service console? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Deploy the cluster nodes in two separate regions and take advantage of multiple availability domains (ADs) in each region.
choices.C: Deploy the cluster nodes in a single region and deploy each node into a different AD.
choices.A: Deploy the cluster nodes in a single region and deploy each node into a different AD. Select the same fault domain in each AD to ensure consistency.
choices.D: Deploy the cluster nodes in a single region and deploy each node in different fault domains within a single AD.

discussion.content: D is right fault domain is the right use case for this
Answer is D. Resilient to HW failure = Fault Domains.

comments.content: response time is the key in the answer not HW failure.

questions.question_text:
You are tasked with creating a highly available clustered application on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure consisting of three nodes. The round-trip latency between nodes must be less than 500Âµs (micro-seconds) and your cluster should be resilient to hardware failure.
What is the recommended deployment strategy?
